Hemispathius polystenoides Belokobylskij & Quicke, 2000
, by original designation.

This genus was originally described from Central Africa ( Uganda ). Examination of type material for
Doryctes species
described by Granger (1949) from Madagascar showed that
D. pilosus Granger, 1949
actually belongs to
Hemispathius
(comb. nov.) due to its shorter and wider first metasomal tergite and its shorter acrosternite. This species, characterised by the entirely yellow colouration, is also found in Yemen .
